newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-HEARTS LINE UP CHANCE OF REVENGE AGAINST RANGERS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-HEARTS LINE UP CHANCE OF REVENGE AGAINST RANGERS.

text.p: Hearts lined up a Scottish League Cup final against Rangers and the chance of a first trophy in 34 years when they swept aside first division leaders Dundee in their semifinal on Wednesday.
Goals from Darren Beckford, Colin Cameron and Stephane Paille had Hearts coasting before Scotland Under-21 striker Jim Hamilton grabbed a consolation for Dundee.
Victory clinched a November 24 final date at Celtic Park against Rangers who crushed Dunfermline in the other semifinal on Tuesday.
It gives Hearts the chance of avenging their 5-1 beating by Rangers in the Scottish Cup final last May.

Beckford, a substitute for the injured John Robertson, struck the opener before Colin Cameron, who won this trophy with Raith two years ago, scored a second from the penalty spot to have Hearts cruising at half-time.
Former French international Paille scored his first goal for the club after an hour to make sure of victory before Hamilton's 73rd-minute reply.
